formattedAddress: 267 W 17th St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 267 W 17th St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: Been here a couple times to get pants/jeans hem and button shirt sleeve altered, and holes in a cashmere sweater fixed. Completely satisfied with their work every time. Great customer service and quick. My go to now.

text.text: Been here a couple times to get pants/jeans hem and button shirt sleeve altered, and holes in a cashmere sweater fixed. Completely satisfied with their work every time. Great customer service and quick. My go to now.

originalText.text: Came to this place in a crisis, needs a dress altered to be a bit bigger in 3 weeks. They worked quickly and now the dress fits perfectly. Will only be coming here for any and all alterations, would highly recommend!!!

text.text: Came to this place in a crisis, needs a dress altered to be a bit bigger in 3 weeks. They worked quickly and now the dress fits perfectly. Will only be coming here for any and all alterations, would highly recommend!!!

originalText.text: Had a dress that I needed hemmed for a future wedding. They took their time ensuring the length was perfect and held it for me for an extra week after I was unable to pick it up on the previously discussed pick-up date. Once I picked up, they made sure it was to my liking. Very friendly and the hemming looked great! Would never have known I got it hemmed, it looks like the dress was made that way from the start. Plus prices seem very fair given the request and fantastic handy work. Highly recommend!

text.text: Had a dress that I needed hemmed for a future wedding. They took their time ensuring the length was perfect and held it for me for an extra week after I was unable to pick it up on the previously discussed pick-up date. Once I picked up, they made sure it was to my liking. Very friendly and the hemming looked great! Would never have known I got it hemmed, it looks like the dress was made that way from the start. Plus prices seem very fair given the request and fantastic handy work. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: This is exactly the type of business every New Yorker should be supporting. Family owned and operated. Prices are fair and the work is high quality.

text.text: This is exactly the type of business every New Yorker should be supporting. Family owned and operated. Prices are fair and the work is high quality.

originalText.text:
They are on the north side of 17th. You go in the exterior door, then downstairs to their shop.  I've been pleased with their work. I've had them hem many pairs of pants and take in the leg on another pair (a seersucker suit I wore in a wedding) and it looked really good.

They charge $16 to hem a pair of pants which is a few dollars more than my old dry cleaner but it's worth it.

I was recently gathering the things I needed hemmed and picked up a pair of pants that I couldn't remember if it needed to be taken up.  Trying to figure it out I took a close look at the hem.  It looked factory, thread matched and the work was very well done. Then I realized it looked too good for factory - I had already had these hemmed. They do good work.
